name: places/ChIJ6QjrLbhbwokRpPEAYkOJhb8
formattedAddress: 89 South St Pier 17, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 89 South St Pier 17, New York, NY 10038, USA

originalText.text:
Possible the greatest rooftop concert venue in the city. Views of the Brooklyn Bridge and lower Manhattan are spectacular. The stage itself is just the right size to be intimate yet there were prolly thousands of people too.

I saw Maya Rudolph's tribute band to Prince. Fun times and good times. Since you have to take escalator out there can be a sizeable bottle neck after the show, but nothing patience can't resolve. Great venue, good times, gorgeous views

text.text:

I saw Maya Rudolph's tribute band to Prince. Fun times and good times. Since you have to take escalator out there can be a sizeable bottle neck after the show, but nothing patience can't resolve. Great venue, good times, gorgeous views

originalText.text: Honestly for a Disney themed event it was lacking. The views are beautiful of course. The ocean skating was ply wood, the hot chocolate was Luke warm. Some of the sets were cute and we got some fun photos. There was a sign that Santa will be back later but I have a feeling Santa is never there and that's just part of the decor. Honestly the best part was the giant skeeball game but if it had been crowded we would not have been able to play since there was only one.

text.text: Honestly for a Disney themed event it was lacking. The views are beautiful of course. The ocean skating was ply wood, the hot chocolate was Luke warm. Some of the sets were cute and we got some fun photos. There was a sign that Santa will be back later but I have a feeling Santa is never there and that's just part of the decor. Honestly the best part was the giant skeeball game but if it had been crowded we would not have been able to play since there was only one.

originalText.text: I love the venue. It was easy to get in and out. The only thing that I didn't care for a few things were number one we were put in or I bought tickets for. I think they called it the promenade which is a sectioned off area with seats. Stage left. Ends up. There were many handicapped people there which is fine. I felt bad for them because it ended up having an obstructed view with people who were not handicapped who are standing room only in the next section in the front of the stage. I think that's unfair to everybody. The lines for the alcohol were also too long. My recommend that you serve regular drinks and beer on one line and mixed drinks on another. Since they take longer. The sound could have been a little bit louder but it was very clear and I enjoyed it.

originalText.text: Santa had an amazing personality. The concept was great. Hot chocolate was delicious. I wish the rink was larger and had real ice. Photo props were good.

text.text: Santa had an amazing personality. The concept was great. Hot chocolate was delicious. I wish the rink was larger and had real ice. Photo props were good.

originalText.text: An amazing concert venue with great sound, awesome views of the city and river and great acts that have come through so far. The only knock I would give is that the drink prices are absolutely astronomical, like $18 for a can of seltzer is a bit much even for NYC
